programme.title: Brothers of the West
programme.desc: Detective Tom Wade (Tom Tyler) has to investigate the truth behind a robbery and murder of a bank president that's being blamed on Tom's brother, Ed (Bob Terry), who is nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Fugitive of the Plains
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Buster Crabbe) stages a shootout with outlaws who have transformed an innocent young lady into a wanted desperado.

programme.title: Phantom Ranger
programme.desc: A federal investigator (Tim McCoy) poses as an outlaw to catch a gang of counterfeiters which has kidnapped a government engraver.

programme.title: 'Neath Canadian Skies
programme.desc: A Mountie (Russell Hayden) tracks mine robbers in 1890s Canada.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat Gallagher and his sidekick Stoney Crockett are Secret Service agents in the Old West, dispatched by the government to investigate crimes threatening the young nation. Starring Russell Hayden, Jackie Coogan.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Gold is stolen from a US government mint; Pat and Stoney are on the case.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Kate tries to restore the self confidence of Floyd Smoot after he is jilted by his mail-order sweetheart, by pretending to be in love with him.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Uncle Joe decides to go into the cologne business.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A clever criminal hopes to rob a wealthy rancher, but Cisco and Pancho bring the man to justice.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: An escaped convict is nearly murdered while trying to prove that he did not commit a crime.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie go to Kansas City to aid in the capture of outlaw brothers Frank and Jesse James.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: When the Apache chief leads a raid on a train depot, looking for weapons and provisions, one of his braves is captured.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: A judge brings his own version of the law to the Old West town of Langtry, Texas.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: Jeff Taggert's brother is accused of robbing the Del Rio bank; while investigating the case, Jeff becomes implicated in the hold up.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie uses the town's new fire engine to capture some bank robbers who are hiding in a shack near town.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) investigates when a young dance teacher has a seemingly ironclad alibi for a series of crimes. With Lou Smith, Sue Smith.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: The Delaware tribe, friends of Chingachcook, are framed for a murder they didn't commit.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Tom and his father are attacked by Hurons; Tom runs away in fear leaving his wounded father behind.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: The Cartwrights' neighbor (Franchot Tone), a former soldier and lawman, seeks security for his daughter.

programme.title: Under Western Stars
programme.desc: A singing-cowboy congressman (Roy Rogers) goes to Washington to save ranchers from a power dam.

programme.title: Wagon Wheels
programme.desc: An Oregon Trail scout (Randolph Scott) woos a member (Gail Patrick) of his wagon train in Indian country.

programme.title: In Old Cheyenne
programme.desc: A singing reporter (Roy Rogers) and a framed man (George "Gabby" Hayes) put a town boss out of business.

programme.title: The Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: James Fenimore Cooper's Hawkeye, Uncas (Albert Roscoe) and Chingachgook help the British in the French and Indian War.

programme.title: Northwest Trail
programme.desc: A Mountie (Bob Steele) escorts a young woman bringing cash to her father in the wild.

programme.title: Winds of the Wasteland
programme.desc: Two former Pony Express riders enter a dilapidated stagecoach in a race for a government mail contract.

programme.title: The Kansan
programme.desc: The new marshal (Richard Dix) of a Kansas town cracks down on his sponsor, a greedy banker (Albert Dekker).

programme.title: Daughter of the West
programme.desc: A convent-raised woman (Martha Vickers) learns of her American Indian heritage through romance with an educated Navajo (Philip Reed) during the 1880s.

programme.title: Riders of the Whistling Skull
programme.desc: The Three Mesquiteers (Bob Livingston, Ray Corrigan, Max Terhune) join a spooky search for a lost city of riches.

programme.title: Roll, Thunder, Roll
programme.desc: Red Ryder (Jim Bannon) and Little Beaver (Don Kay Reynolds) help a Mexican Robin Hood framed by raiders.

programme.title: Ridin' the Lone Trail
programme.desc: A cowboy (Bob Steele) clears a woman rancher (Claire Rochelle) suspected of robbery.
